subtitle: An alternative to summer pudding using blackberries and dried apple.

method.text: Drain the syrup from the plums into a pan with the cinnamon. Bring to the boil. Pour over the apple rings and leave to stand for 1 hour until re-hydrated.
Place the apple rings and any remaining syrup in a large pan. Add the sugar, blackberries and sultanas. Bring to the boil then simmer for 5 min until softened but still retaining their shape.
Meanwhile, remove the crusts from the bread. Cut out a round of bread from one slice large enough to cover the base of 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> ltr pudding basin.
Cut 8 of the remaining slices into 5 cm wide fingers. Arrange the bread slices in the base of, and around the sides of, the basin, overlapping them slightly to ensure there are no gaps.
Spoon the cooked fruit into the bread-lined basin. Cut the remaining bread slice into a round large enough to cover the fruit.
Cover with a saucer just large enough to fit inside the bowl. Place a weight on the top. Chill overnight.
To serve, carefully run a knife around the edge of the basin to loosen then turn out onto a serving plate.

title: Autumn pudding
